overview:
Intel Capital Director based in Moscow, responsible for investments in Russia and CIS.

Intel Capital, Intel’s global investment and M&A organization, makes equity investments in innovative technology start-ups and companies worldwide. Intel Capital invests in a broad range of companies offering hardware, software, and services targeting enterprise, home, mobility, health, consumer Internet, semiconductor manufacturing and cleantech. Since 1991, Intel Capital has invested more than $10bn in over 1,100 companies in 51 countries. In 2011, Intel Capital invested $526mm across 158 new deals with approximately 51% of funds invested outside the United States and Canada.

Prior to joining Intel Capital, Maxim was Investment Director at Alfa Capital Partners, . At Alfa he completed a number of private equity transactions in Russia, Turkey and Kazakhstan, totaling ca. $200mm. Before joining Alfa, Maxim worked in investment banking and direct investing at Fleming Family and Partners, a British multifamily office. He started his career in the Corporate Finance group of PwC, advising Russian and multinational clients on M&As, disposals and strategy. At PwC his focus was on telecommunications, media and technology and he completed over a dozen of advisory projects representing more than $1bn of capital. Maxim received his MBA from Columbia Business School in New York and a MS in Finance from Finance University in Moscow. He is a Member of the CFA Institute.
